page.title: 06THE NEW EXPRESSWAY
page.content: The new expressway,known as the A55 was constructed to ease the traffic congestion on the North Wales coast. It is a high speed road,entered by slip roads.It extends from Llanddulas to Llandudno Junction,in all about twelve kilometres.In Llanddulas they have reclaimed land from the sea.In order to do this they put heavy rocks on the embankment followed by twenty- two thousand concrete blocks called dolos.Each block weighs five tonnes. This was done to prevent the sea eroding the embankment and damaging the road.Part of the Chester to Holyhead railway line had to be diverted and approximately one hundred and ninety houses had to be demolished to make way for the new road.The station forecourt has been reconstructed on an underpass eighty metres long.
